intro: Rorippa polymorpha, commonly known as the common watercress, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its alternate, trifoliate leaves that are often submerged or floating in aquatic environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically arranged in racemes, and it is well adapted to moist or waterlogged soils. Rorippa polymorpha is a cosmopolitan species, found in various parts of the world, including Europe, Asia, and North America. It plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various organisms.
